alert.note: Alert for Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 1:13PM CDT until June 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, in northwest Texas, Bailey. In the Panhandle of Texas, Parmer. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the line of storm was moving east out of the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Muleshoe has received 0.82 inches. is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muleshoe, Friona, Progress, Oklahoma Lane, Lazbuddie, Lariat, West Camp and Black. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
